intro: Petalostemon carolinensis, commonly known as Carolina petalostemon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals that are fused at the base, giving it its name. The plant is relatively small, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance to local pollinators.
